meanings.sent1: The falsest statement claimed the sky was green.
meanings.sent2: She knew it was falsest when he said he could fly.
meanings.sent3: The falsest excuse for not doing homework was that the dog ate it.
meanings.sent4: His falsest smile couldn't hide the sadness in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The falsest rumor spread like wildfire through the school.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with fact or reality.
meanings.sent1: The falsest belief was that the moon was made of cheese.
meanings.sent2: His falsest claim was that he could turn invisible at will.
meanings.sent3: The falsest prediction was that it would rain cats and dogs.
meanings.sent4: Her falsest dream shattered when she woke up.
meanings.sent5: The falsest idea that aliens walk among us is just a conspiracy theory.

meanings.sent1: The falsest advertisement promised eternal youth in a bottle.
meanings.sent2: His falsest promise to always be there turned out to be a lie.
meanings.sent3: The falsest compliment was that her cooking was out of this world.
meanings.sent4: The falsest appearance of happiness masked his true emotions.
meanings.sent5: The falsest marketing tactic tricked many into buying unnecessary products.

meanings.sent1: The falsest diamond turned out to be a cheap imitation.
meanings.sent2: Her falsest friend only pretended to care when it suited her.
meanings.sent3: The falsest painting looked like a masterpiece from afar.
meanings.sent4: His falsest apology lacked sincerity and remorse.
meanings.sent5: The falsest sense of security left them vulnerable to danger.
